intro: Machaerina aromatica, commonly known as the fragrant machaerina, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salty air. Its aromatic leaves release a pleasant scent when crushed, contributing to its common name. Machaerina aromatica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in challenging environments.
